medical_history.chief_complaint: Development of nonsensical speech including confused word choices and difficulty naming objects.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the day prior to presentation with headache, nausea, vomiting, and fatigue. These symptoms progressed to fluctuating orientation and comprehension throughout the morning of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cancer of the distal sigmoid colon diagnosed 4 years previously, successfully treated with resection and chemotherapy. No history of chronic headaches, weakness, numbness, or incontinence.
medical_history.family_history: Notable for diabetes mellitus type 1 in her sister and hypothyroidism in her mother.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked half a pack of cigarettes per day for about 10 years before quitting (exact quit date is uncertain). Married, lived in Michigan, previously worked in an administrative capacity, no recent travel outside the state, no recent contact with sick persons.
